subject: Economics
title: The Container Revolution: The Box That Changed Everything
description: A fast breakdown of The Container Revolution: The Box That Changed Everything for builders.

hook.text: Before 1956, shipping a ton of goods cost $5.86. After the shipping container, it cost 16 cents.

buildup.text: Malcom McLean, a trucking entrepreneur, realized loading loose cargo onto ships was insanely inefficient.

discovery.text: The standardized 40-foot container made loading automated. A ship that took a week to load now loaded in hours.

twist.text: Longshoremen unions fought containers fiercely â€” dockworker jobs fell 90%.

climax.text: The shipping container made it cheaper to manufacture 10,000 miles away than next door.

punchline.text: A metal box did more for global trade than any trade agreement ever written.

quiz.question: How did the shipping container transform global trade?
options: It reduced shipping costs by 97%, making manufacturing anywhere in the world economically viable
